edm_styles.name: House
characteristics: Four-on-the-floor kick drum on every beat
Use of samples and piano/organ stabs
typical_instruments: Synth bass (e.g. Juno, TB-303 in some styles)

common_rhythm_patterns: Snare or clap on beats 2 and 4
Off-beat open hi-hat on the ands

timeline.description: Early warehouse and club tracks in Chicago with strong disco and funk influence.
Spread to the UK and Europe; development of deep house and progressive house.
Mainstream crossover with vocal house and commercial club music.
Festival and pop crossover while underground house remains strong.

subgenres.name: Deep House
characteristics: Often jazzy harmony and subtle vocals

subgenres.name: Tech House
characteristics: Focus on rhythm and sound design

subgenres.name: Progressive House
characteristics: Melodic but less euphoric than trance

edm_styles.name: Techno
characteristics: Emphasis on drum machines and synthesizers

timeline.description: Detroit origin, early European adoption and club circulation.
Harder and industrial forms in Europe; rise of minimal techno.
Techno as a global club standard; analog revival and festival stages.

subgenres.name: Detroit Techno
characteristics: Blend of funk with mechanical drums

subgenres.name: Industrial Techno
characteristics: Influence from industrial and noise music

timeline.description: Early trance with hypnotic loops and minimal melody.
Anthem and uplifting era with huge melodies and supersaw leads.
Progressive and psy-influenced variants, pop-vocal crossover.

subgenres.name: Uplifting Trance
characteristics: Supersaw leads and strong sidechain compression

edm_styles.name: Dubstep
characteristics: Dark, spacious sound design in early forms

common_rhythm_patterns: Kick on beat 1, snare on beat 3 (half-time feel)

timeline.description: Dark, sparse, sub-heavy tracks from South London producers.
Growth of deep dubstep and early international recognition.
Explosion of aggressive brostep and festival-oriented sound.
Coexistence of deep, experimental dubstep and heavy riddim styles.

subgenres.name: Deep Dubstep
characteristics: Minimal drums with strong sub-bass focus

subgenres.name: Riddim
characteristics: Focus on groove and head-nod movement

subgenres.name: Drumstep
characteristics: DnB tempos with half-time dubstep feel
Fast breaks with heavy bass drops
Hybrid of drum & bass and dubstep

edm_styles.name: Drum and Bass
characteristics: High energy and rapid drum programming
Use of sampled funk breaks (e.g. Amen break)

timeline.description: Transition from jungle to early drum & bass with darker tones.
Rise of techstep and liquid funk; more polished production.
Global mainstream recognition and stylistic diversification.

subgenres.name: Liquid DnB
characteristics: Less aggressive drums than other DnB styles

subgenres.name: Jungle
characteristics: Chopped Amen and other funk breaks
Heavy use of bass and sound system culture

timeline.description: EDM festivals adopt trap drops and 808-heavy breakdowns.
Fusion with future bass, pop and bass music; more melodic variants.

subgenres.name: Festival Trap
characteristics: Huge builds and drops for big stages

subgenres.name: Hybrid Trap
characteristics: Trap drums with dubstep-style sound design

subgenres.name: Future Trap
characteristics: More melodic and emotional than festival trap
Use of chords and atmospheric pads
Combination of trap drums with lush harmonies

edm_styles.name: Future Bass
characteristics: Heavy sidechain compression for a pumping effect

timeline.description: Early experimentation by internet and SoundCloud producers.
Mainstream popularity with vocal-driven tracks and pop crossovers.

subgenres.name: Kawaii Future Bass
characteristics: Influence from anime and J-Pop aesthetics

subgenres.name: Melodic Future Bass
characteristics: Strong focus on chord progressions and melody

common_rhythm_patterns: Kick on every beat at ~150 BPM

timeline.description: Early hardstyle with reverse bass and gabber influence.
Euphoric melodies and festival adoption.
Split between raw, darker styles and melodic euphoric forms.

subgenres.name: Hardcore (cross-over)
characteristics: Extremely fast tempo and distorted kicks

edm_styles.name: Electro
characteristics: Prominent use of TR-808 drum sounds

timeline.description: Breakdance and early hip-hop electro with heavy 808 use.
Underground revival, Detroit electro and European scenes.
Influence on electro house, techno and bass music.

subgenres.name: Fidget House
characteristics: Heavy use of filters and stutters

edm_styles.name: Breakbeat
characteristics: Strong influence from hip-hop and funk

common_rhythm_patterns: Broken kick-snare patterns with ghost notes

timeline.description: Breakbeat hardcore and early rave scene in the UK.
Development of nu skool breaks and big beat.
Niche but persistent underground scenes and crossovers.

subgenres.name: Nu Skool Breaks
characteristics: Emphasis on basslines and modern sound design

subgenres.name: Progressive Breaks
characteristics: Hybrid of progressive house and breakbeat

edm_styles.name: Ambient
characteristics: Focus on timbre and space over rhythm and melody
Often used for relaxation or background listening

timeline.description: Brian Eno and early ambient experiments.
Ambient house and chill-out rooms in raves.
Digital and cinematic ambient, game and film soundtracks.

subgenres.name: Dark Ambient
characteristics: Influence from industrial and experimental music

artists.name: Lustmord
notable_tracks: The Place Where the Black Stars Hang

subgenres.name: Ambient House
characteristics: Use of vocal samples and spoken word
Chill-out style suitable for relaxed dancing

subgenres.name: Space Ambient
characteristics: Long, slowly evolving drones and pads

edm_styles.name: Bass House
characteristics: House drums with wobbling, heavy basslines
Influence from UK bass and garage

timeline.description: Emergence in UK and US bass scenes with strong online/SoundCloud presence.
Festival adoption and fusion with tech house and mainstream house.

subgenres.name: UK Bass
characteristics: Heavy, subby basslines with house or garage drums

subgenres.name: G-House
characteristics: House beats with hip-hop style vocals
Influence from gangsta rap and bass music

artists.name: Amine Edge & DANCE
notable_tracks: Going to Heaven with the Goodie-Goodies
